business.headline: New labour codes: What changes for paid leave, work hours and health benefitsThe new labour codes apply across sectors and are designed to improve safety, reduce fatigue and make workplaces more predictable for millions of workers.

Gratuity in a year? Only if you're a fixed-term employee. Here's what it meansOnly employees hired on fixed-term contracts qualify for the new one-year gratuity rule. Permanent staff remain under the five-year norm, making this benefit exclusive to India's expanding fixed-term workforce.

From gratuity to gig worker insurance: What new labour laws mean for employeesFrom gratuity to insurance and safer workplaces, the new rules expand what employees can expect from their jobs. Staying informed will help workers make the most of these changes.

Fixed-term employees to get gratuity after 1 year of service under new labour lawsAccording to the Union Labour Ministry, the restructuring is aimed at ensuring better wages, wider social security coverage and improved health-related protections for workers across sectors.

Sensex tumbles 400 points, Nifty ends above 26,000 amid volatile tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex fell more than 400 points to close at 85,231, while the NSE Nifty50 managed to stay above the 26,000 mark despite broad-based weakness across sectors.

Government implements four labour codes, replacing 29 old laws. Check detailsThe move brings together decades-old labour rules that were scattered across multiple legislations into a consolidated framework. Many of these older laws date back to the pre-Independence and early post-Independence era.

Rupee slides to record low of Rs 89.45 amid US-India trade uncertaintyThe outlook for the rupee remains uncertain as global risk sentiment stays fragile and investors wait for clearer signals from both the Fed and ongoing trade negotiations between Washington and New Delhi.

Sudeep Pharma IPO fully subscribed on day 1. Check latest GMP and otherThe issue, priced between Rs 563 and Rs 593, saw a clear surge from retail and high-net-worth investors, allowing the company to cross the one-time subscription mark even though institutional participation remained weak through the first session.

How GMP and social media hype mislead so many first-time investorsThe Great IPO Gamble series ends here, and in part 3, we break down how GMP and social media hype influence first-time investors. A look at the noise behind the numbers.

Recipe for trouble? Zomato's customer data move stirs up controversyZomato controversy: Food delivery giant Zomato has decided to share customer data with restaurants after years of tussle. Politicians and marketing gurus have called it a recipe for trouble, expressing concerns about data privacy and spam messages.

Russian Oil: Reliance Halts Russian Crude Imports at Jamnagar SEZ RefineryThis report covers Reliance Industries' decision to halt the import of Russian crude oil for its export-oriented refinery in Jamnagar, Gujarat. The move is in compliance with European Union and United States sanctions targeting Russian oil majors Rosneft and Lukoil, with a wind-down period ending November 21. Reliance stated, 'we'll stay aligned with government's policy.' The company will now source crude from other regions, including West Asia and the EU, for its Special Economic Zone (SEZ) refinery, with all exports to be derived from non-Russian oil starting December 1. The decision impacts a long-term deal between Reliance and Rosneft for the supply of crude oil.

JP Power share price tumbles 7% after strong rally. Why is it down today?The JP Power share price dip reflects profit-taking after a steep run, as the market waits for clearer evidence that the broader group's restructuring will lift the company's long-term fortunes.

Groww shares jump nearly 7% after two-day tumble: What's driving today's rally?Around 10:03 am, the shares of the company were trading 6.30% higher at Rs 166.44 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The rebound comes amid growing anticipation around Groww's performance.

Sensex, Nifty fall in early trade as hopes of US rate cut fadeAround 9:23 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 131 points at 85,501.03, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 40.70 points to 26,151.45. Volatility was high in early trade and all major sectoral indices were in the red, reflecting the cautious mood on Dalal Street.

Reliance ends use of Russian crude for exports to comply with EU sanctionsReliance's decision shows how quickly the global rules around Russian oil are changing, and how Indian refiners are now being pushed to realign their supply chains.

Reliance Group says ED-attached assets belong to RCom, not part of group since 2019The ED, meanwhile, detailed its searches across Tamil Nadu in a land-forgery and inflated compensation scam involving forged deeds, dummy buyers and layered transactions, seizing and freezing assets worth Rs 18.10 crore.

Waiting for your tax refund? Here's why it's delayed and when it may arriveAccording to the Income Tax Department, more than 7.57 crore returns were filed by September 23, yet refunds for many taxpayers remain pending.

Sensex ends nearly 450 points higher, Nifty nears life-time highThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 446.21 points to close at 85,632.68, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 139.50 points to finish at 26,192.15. Broader indices were mixed, but the tone across frontline stocks remained firmly positive, led by gains in heavyweight financial counters.

Sensex surges 500 points, Nifty nears life-time high. What's driving the rally?At 1.58 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 526.63 points to 85,713.10, while the NSE Nifty50 hit a fresh 52-week high and was nearing an all-time high of 26,277.

Groww share price falls 10% again: Is the post-listing rally over?Around 1:12 pm, shares of the company were trading 9.18% lower at Rs 154.30. Over the last two sessions, the stock has slipped nearly 18%, a sharp reversal that has investors wondering whether the post-listing rally has already run its course.

entertainment.headline: Kamal Haasan, Kushboo Sundar, Suhasini reunite at IFFI Goa, learn about cinema Kamal Haasan, Suhasini and Kushboo Sundar reunited at IFFI Goa, sharing a warm moment that reflected their long-standing bond and love for cinema. The actors shared a bunch of photos on Instagram.

Cardi B turns newborn's umbilical cord into gold pendant, internet stops to blink Cardi B has celebrated the arrival of her fourth child, her first with Stefon Diggs, by turning her son's umbilical cord into a gold pendant and preserving other personal birth mementos.

Guide: A Timeless Dance of Destiny, Liberation, and Love As part of our Retro Review series we revisit Vijay Anand's Guide. One of the greatest Indian movies, 'Guide' masterfully blends captivating performances, evocative music, and innovative storytelling to explore the transformative journey of two souls navigating art, love, and destiny's diktats

Tu Meri Zindagi Hai to Naagzilla: Inside Kartik Aaryan's power-packed film slate As Kartik Aaryan celebrates his birthday, his upcoming slate signals one of the most ambitious phases of his career. From the comfort of 'Tu Meri Main Tera...' to the high-stakes leap of 'Naagzilla', the next year charts a bold shift.

Legend of Begum Akhtar: How AIR Lucknow recorded her secret return after 8 years Begum Akhtar made a silent musical comeback through a secret recording by AIR Lucknow's then-director LK Malhotra. Writer Yatindra Mishra, speaking at Sahitya AajTak, shared her comeback story.

Kapoors spill secrets: Ranbir eats the most, Kareena says none have filters The Kapoor family share amusing insights on candidness and appetite, with Ranbir Kapoor singled out as the biggest glutton. The clip has been shared on Netflix's Instagram page.

Eddie Murphy to be honoured with Life Achievement Award by American Film Institute Eddie Murphy will receive the American Film Institute Life Achievement Award in April 2025, recognising his lasting influence in film, television, and comedy over several decades.

Jennifer Lopez lands in India for billionaire wedding, waves and blows kiss to paps Jennifer Lopez arrives in India to perform at US billionaire's daughter Netra Mantena's high-profile wedding, joining a lineup of global celebrities and Bollywood stars amid grand celebrations in Udaipur.

Ranveer Singh, Trump Jr trend, Janhvi and Shahid perform at billionaire wedding Bollywood celebrities and international stars gathered in Udaipur for the lavish wedding of US-based billionaire Padmaja and Rama Raju Mantena's daughter, Netra. Ranveer Singh and other performers entertained guests, including Donald Trump Jr and Bettina Anderson.

Not a Malayali? No problem. Here's why Malayalam films still make sense Malayalam movies are taking over India — not with hype, but with heart. Real characters, real emotions, zero drama-for-the-sake-of-drama. No Malayalam? No problem. The storytelling does the talking.

Meghan Trainor turns cyberbullying into fiery new single Still Don't Care Pop singer Meghan Trainor explores the impact of online negativity with her new single 'Still Don't Care' and announces the 'Get in Girl' tour for 2026.

Bigg Boss 19: Deepak Chahar says he's praised for sister Malti; house gets emotional Cricketer Deepak Chahar entered the 'Bigg Boss 19' house during family week, expressing pride in being known as contestant Malti Chahar's brother, while sharing light-hearted moments and stories with housemates.

Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan audio launch set for December in Malaysia The 'Jana Nayagan' audio launch will take place at Bukit Jalil Stadium in Kuala Lumpur on December 27, marking Thalapathy Vijay's return to Malaysia after three years and his last film event before retirement.

Is Shin Min Ah pregnant with Kim Woo Bin's first child? Agency responds Shin Min Ah and Kim Woo Bin will marry in a private ceremony at the Shilla Hotel in December 2025, following ten years together.  Speculations emerged that the marriage decision was prompted by a premarital pregnancy.

Shefali Shah says she was overjoyed and weeping with relief over Delhi Crime 3 Shefali Shah shared that she was "terrified" before Delhi Crime 3 dropped, unsure if the audience would accept her non-bravado side of Vartika. However, the subsequent "outpour" of love led to the actor being "overjoyed and weeping with relief."

Palash Muchhal–Smriti Mandhana wedding begins with their haldi ceremony Wedding celebrations for Indian cricket star Smriti Mandhana and composer-filmmaker Palash Muchhal began today with a vibrant Haldi ceremony attended by friends, family, and members of the Indian women's cricket team.

Piyush Mishra to Gen Z: Do your Karma, don't live a second rate life like a corpse Piyush Mishra, at the Sahitya Aaj Tak 2025, spoke about his book 'Tumhari Aukaat Kya Hai Piyush Mishra'. He also opened up on his friendship and commented on Gen Z's obsession with social media likes.

12A Railway Colony review: Weak writing turns thriller into a twist dumpRelease Date:Fri Nov 21, 2025  '12A Railway Colony' starts with a promising setup, but the thriller quickly derails as weak writing, shallow logic and a rush of unearned twists take over.

general news.headline: Central panel tightens pollution curbs in Delhi as air quality remains very poorThe Commission for Air Quality Management has tightened pollution-control measures in Delhi-NCR by revising GRAP, shifting several curbs to lower stages as air quality stays in the 'Very Poor' category.

From gratuity to gig worker insurance: What new labour laws mean for employeesFrom gratuity to insurance and safer workplaces, the new rules expand what employees can expect from their jobs. Staying informed will help workers make the most of these changes.

Major arms racket busted in Delhi, China-made weapons were supplied from PakThe syndicate, linked to Pakistan's ISI, used to supply the consignments of high-end China and Turkey-made weapons to Lawrence Bishnoi and other notorious gangs in the Delhi-NCR and its surrounding states.

2nd Test Day 1 Live: Bavuma, Stubbs in control at lunchIndia vs South Africa live score 2nd Test Day 1 Updates: Another session goes in favour of South Africa as Bavuma and Stubbs frustrate the Indian team with their steady and positive approach. How is India failing, and fixing, mental health in its schools?Are Indian schools failing their own students when it comes to mental health aid?

US lawmaker who wanted to kill H-1B programme to resign amid Trump feudRepublican Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene, who proposed a bill to end the H-1B visa programme, has announced she would resign as a lawmaker. Greene, a longtime Donald Trump ally, had clashed with the US President recently, and took a confrontationist stand on the H-1B programme.

Who was Wing Commander Namansh Syal, IAF pilot killed in Tejas jet crashWing Commander Namansh Syal, 34, of the Indian Air Force, was martyred after the indigenous Tejas fighter jet crashed during a practice sortie at the Dubai Air Show.

Plot twist of 2025: The Trump-Mamdani collab internet was not expectingWhat was expected to be a fiery political showdown between Donald Trump and Zohran Mamdani turned into a cordial meeting no one saw coming, which triggered a wave of memes over the plot twist nobody predicted.

Difficult to get out of chakravyuh: Jagdeep Dhankhar's 1st speech after exitJagdeep Dhankhar, who resigned in July as vice president, opened his speech by speaking of his long public absence. He warned against getting caught in a narrative.

China used India-Pak conflict as testing ground for its new weapons: ReportThe report also said that Chinese embassies publicly touted the 'success' of Beijing's weapons during the India-Pakistan clash and later pushed a disinformation drive aimed at undermining French Rafales to boost its own fighter jet sales.

A Class 4 child died by suicide. CBSE now lists 18 months of ignored warningsCBSE has issued a show cause notice to Neerja Modi School in Jaipur after a Class 4 student died by suicide following alleged bullying and major safety lapses. India Today has accessed the notice, which details 18 months of ignored bullying complaints and how the child's five repeated calls for help went unanswered in the final hour.

CGC University, Mohali: Where vision becomes legacy and education becomes evolutionStories of students who dare to dream, of educators who ignite curiosity, and of a community that chooses progress with purpose.

How Taliban are planning trade with India via air and sea to bypass PakistanIndia and Afghanistan are set to deepen trade ties through Iran's Chabahar port and new cargo flights from Delhi and Amritsar to Kabul. The move, announced during Afghan Trade Minister Nooruddin Azizi's visit, includes commercial attaches, investment incentives, and streamlined logistics. Kabul is shifting away from Islamabad to boost exports.

Ready to support Nitish government, but...: Owaisi's Seemanchal conditionOwaisi, whose party emerged as the dark horse by winning five seats in the Bihar elections, asserted that development should not remain confined only to capital Patna and Rajgir.

Do IV drips belong at weddings? The risks are too serious to ignoreIf you spot an IV drip bar at the next wedding you attend, think twice before signing up as it could lead to serious health risks.

Without Hindus, world will not exist: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's bold claimRSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, speaking in Manipur, asserted that Hindu society was immortal, pointing out that India had outlasted empires like those of Yunaan (Greece), Misr (Egypt), and Rome.

Watch: Reporter asks Mamdani if Trump is a fascist. Here's his responseDonald Trump and Zohran Mamdani shed their usual selves of trading insults as pictures of the two smiling at the White House took over the Internet. Both the US President and the New York City Mayor-elect called their meeting "productive".

IndiGo passenger claims items worth Rs 40,000 stolen as checked-in suitcases cut openA woman from Mumbai said items worth Rs 40,000 were stolen from her suitcases, which she claimed were cut open during her IndiGo flight.

sports.headline: Resurgent Lakshya Sen wins 86-minute marathon to storm into final Lakshya Sen reached the Australian Open final with a dramatic comeback win over second seed Chou Tien Chen. Sen prevailed 17-21, 24-22, 21-16 in a tense semifinal, booking his place in the title match after 86 minutes of high-intensity badminton on Saturday in Sydney.

The Ashes: Mitchell Starc becomes first pacer in 12 years to take a 10-wicket haul Mitchell Starc delivered a sensational ten-wicket match haul in Perth, becoming the first pacer in 12 years to achieve the feat in the Ashes. His dismissals of Crawley, Root and Stokes powered Australia to control as he also crossed 200 World Test Championship wickets, joining an elite bowling group.

Coach Sunil Joshi faces heat over Vaibhav Suryavanshi Super Over blunder India A suffered a semi-final loss to Bangladesh A in the Asia Cup Rising Stars 2025 on Friday. The omission of star batter Vaibhav Suryavanshi in the Super Over has sparked widespread criticism and debate.

Las Vegas GP: Norris takes pole, Hamilton dead last in qualifying Lando Norris secured pole position for the Las Vegas Grand Prix in challenging wet conditions, edging out Max Verstappen, while title rival Oscar Piastri settled for fifth on the grid. Lewis Hamilton had a qualifying to forget as he finished in 20th spot.

Watch: Stuart Broad's on-air meltdown goes viral after Joe Root's twin failure Ashes 1st Test, AUS vs ENG: Stuart Broad was left speechless as he watched Joe Root fail for the second time in the first Test. Mitchell Starc ran riot, completing a 10-wicket haul in Perth on Saturday.

Bavuma's quiet captaincy, no superstars: Jonty Rhodes on South Africa's resurgence South Africa's resurgence in Test cricket is built on belief, resilience, and a new leadership identity under Temba Bavuma. With historic wins at home and abroad, the Proteas are redefining what it means to be a modern Test powerhouse.

Greatest return catch? Watch Mitchell Starc's age-defying effort in Perth Test Australia vs England, Ashes 1st Test: Mitchell Starc, 35, pulled off a sensational return catch to hand Zak Crawley a pair in Perth. Having taken seven in the first innings, the senior fast bowler struck early again on Saturday, with many wondering whether his effort was one of the greatest return catches in cricket history.

New captain, same old luck as Rishabh Pant loses toss in Guwahati India vs South Africa, 2nd Test: India's stand-in captain Rishabh Pant lost the coin toss as South Africa opted to bat in Guwahati. India made two changes to their XI for the must-win match.

USA cricketer charged for ICC anti-corruption code breach USA cricketer Akhilesh Reddy has been provisionally suspended after the ICC charged him with three breaches of its Anti-Corruption Code during the 2025 Abu Dhabi T10 tournament. Reddy now has 14 days to respond as the ICC, acting for the Emirates Cricket Board, proceeds with its investigation.

How Ben Stokes rejuvenated England after Perth Test collapse, Brydon Carse revealsBrydon Carse said England staged a strong comeback in the Ashes opener at Perth, with Ben Stokes' leadership and five-wicket haul inspiring the bowlers, while he himself picked up two key wickets.

Suryakumar Yadav named in Mumbai squad for Syed Mushtaq Ali TrophySuryakumar Yadav has been named in Mumbai's 17-member squad for the 2025–26 Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, aiming to regain form ahead of India's white-ball schedule while strengthening the defending champions.

IND vs SA live streaming, Guwahati Test: Session timings, where to watch in IndiaIndia face South Africa in the second Test at Guwahati with Rishabh Pant captaining for the first time. The match features a historic tea break before lunch due to early sunset in the region.

Guwahati Test: Home pride at stake as shaky India face confident South AfricaIND vs SA, 2nd Test: India step into uncharted territory in Guwahati, battling form, injuries and rising doubts, while buoyant South Africa chase a rare series triumph on Indian soil in a historic Test showdown.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi should've batted in Super Over. Captain explains why he didn'tRising Stars Asia Cup: Jitesh Sharma explained why India A didn't send Vaibhav Suryavanshi for the Super Over in their semi-final against Bangladesh A on Friday in Doha. Suryavanshi had scored 38 off 15 balls, including two fours and four sixes, but India still crashed out of the tournament.

Watching Ashes made us jealous, hope we also get to play 4-5 Tests: Temba BavumaSouth Africa's captain Temba Bavuma shared his disappointment over his team's limited Test opportunities. He revealed that watching the Ashes made him jealous as he hoped for a longer series, especially against top cricketing nations like India.

Samson on playing with Dhoni at CSK: Destiny has brought us to same dressing roomSanju Samson expressed excitement about sharing the dressing room with MS Dhoni and contributing to CSK's future plans. The wicketkeeper batter has been traded to the five-time champions ahead of IPL 2026.

Despite Bangladesh brain fade, India crash out in Rising Stars Asia Cup semi-finalIndia A suffered heartbreak in the Rising Stars Asia Cup semi-final at Doha, tying the match off a last-ball brain fade from Bangladesh A but ultimately losing in the Super Over. Ripon Mondal picked up two wickets in the one-over eliminator as the Tigers had the last laugh.

IND vs SA: Rabada to miss ODI series, Nortje returns to international cricketSouth Africa fast bowler Kagiso Rabada has flown back home due to a rib injury and is set to miss the ODI series against India. Rabada got injured during a practice session ahead of the first Test in Kolkata.

The Ashes: Starc reveals Usman Khawaja's back spasm triggered late batting order chaosMitchell Starc has revealed that Usman Khawaja's back spasm, suffered while he was off the field, forced a sudden reshuffle in Australia's batting order on day one of the first Ashes Test in Perth. Khawaja, unable to bat in his usual slot, arrived at No. 3 but fell cheaply as Australia collapsed to 123-9, still 49 behind England.

IND vs SA, 2nd Test Predicted 11: Who replaces Gill, Sundar to continue at No.3?India head into the 2nd Test needing a win to stay alive in the series. With Shubman Gill ruled out, major changes are expected in the batting order, including an end to the Washington Sundar No. 3 experiment. South Africa may consider bringing back Lungi Ngidi.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
